author: randall
title: Done Collectively Discord Integrati
description: Next-gen DAO collaboration platform needs strong connectivity with ubiquitous chat platform to connect people in gov process

f6_assessments.q0: Integrating Discord in the "Done Collectively" platform solves a few of the problems in the Dapps challenge setting. Discord is widely used in the blockchain space and it makes sense to build this integration. Many users will be able to choose their preferred method of interaction with DC. Either through Discord or through their platform. Giving the end user this choice makes for more onboarding as users dont have to dedicate to one option. They can use both. Making the user experience better in DAO operation will bring more people to Cardano and make them more efficient. Getting more people to use their integration with Discord aligns with the challenge as Discord is a key application in the blockchain ecosystem. This integration will be able to scale because of its simplicity and there is room for evolution in both Discord and the integration itself.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has the relevant experience for the  main project, but they still need a JavaScript developer to build the Discord integration, which they will most likely find in their immediate communities. The budget is broken down into identifiable tasks, each task at a rate of $100/hour. The time allocated to these tasks seems achievable. They explain the different ways this integration will work, using Discord webhooks for their DC platform and building a Discord bot. The bot will be built by the JavaScript developer. They mention a few other resources needed to build this project in the budget breakdown. The way their product is built automatically mitigates some of the most common risks a project like this can face. Their decentralized system operations is a key factor in this and makes it resilient to completely failing.
f6_assessments.q2: They provided a 2 month roadmap with milestones to track the  progress of this integration. The KPIs they provided makes it easy to measure the performance of this integration. They clearly describe the problem of DOAs needing integrations with Discord as it is the most used app in the blockchain space for communicating. And archiving the chats for more decentralization. Their solution to this problem is simple and effective. It is an integration between Discord and their own platform. Connecting the 2 platforms and giving the end users options and the chat data is more decentralized.

f6_assessments.q0: "Putting the problem is clear and so is the proposed solution. The impact of the project is high since having access to talent in the specialized world of Daos is currently not a simple task and is still needed. Having a simple and effective tool to acquire the required talent will be a distinct advantage for Cardano, will drive sustained growth, and is easily scalable. skilled people interested in the DAO space will eventually go where they can find work, therefore, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
"The team has all the skills needed to make this project a reality and provide a lengthy bio and LinkedIn profile for verification. At the time of writing this review, link the LinkedIn profile to one of them. Team members have decreased however a quick Google search can provide all the background information required.This recommendation is broken down into segments that can work with what looks like frameworks. appropriate time to complete each segment. The budget is also broken down in a way that shows how much money will be spent and seems reasonable and realistic to accomplish the stated goals. part of the Risk Analysis section by stating that future funding will be purchased by one of the team members. Considering the background and experience of this team it seems very likely to succeed and this too. is included as an objective in the proposed milestones.In general, the plan is detailed, realistic and describes well how it will be implementation and therefore I completely agree that it is very likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
"
f6_assessments.q2:
A roadmap has been included and the timeframes seem realistic. There is no officially stated method to verify progress however due to the nature of the proposal, . A stated purpose of code audits also makes for a very effective means of assessing progress. The auditor's identity and expected costs would be useful information to add here. A simple but relevant success metric is listed, and it should be relatively easy to verify. Given these factors, I agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to gauge progress towards achieving the stated goals.
"

f6_assessments.q0: This is a very well-made, quite descriptive proposal that right away shows that already a lot of work and thought has been put into it. By helping facilitating and organizing communication, it will have a great deal of positive impact on the ecosystem and its community and be a mich needed scalability tool. Great work!
f6_assessments.q1: A couple of the people behind this proposal are already an active part in the catalyst community and reading the proposal it quickly becomes clear that they know what they're talkkng about. The implementation plan is very extensive and well-reflected and shows that a solid foundation has already been made. A good contingency plan and consolidation strategies are contained as well. The budget is detailed and realistic. All in all an excellent job in making a feasible proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Both the problem and the solution are described in great detail. The metrics for auditability both along the way of implementation and for the proposal in action are well-made, from the roadmap to the KPIs.

solution: Integrates chat for DAO Groups/Proposals/Projects with Discord channels; archives those Discord channel messages for better decentralization
experience: 25+ years software development, Catalyst Community members, active ongoing collaborator: ADAO, Gimabalabs, DEMU, Web3:4Life, more
